refnamediv.refpurpose: A filter for selecting a subset of recently used files

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkRecentFilter can be used to restrict the files being shown in a GtkRecentChooser. Files can be filtered based on their name (with gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern()), on their mime type (with gtk_file_filter_add_mime_type()), on the application that has registered them (with gtk_recent_filter_add_application()), or by a custom filter function (with gtk_recent_filter_add_custom()).

Filtering by mime type handles aliasing and subclassing of mime types; e.g. a filter for text/plain also matches a file with mime type application/rtf, since application/rtf is a subclass of text/plain. Note that GtkRecentFilter allows wildcards for the subtype of a mime type, so you can e.g. filter for image/*.
Normally, filters are used by adding them to a GtkRecentChooser, see gtk_recent_chooser_add_filter(), but it is also possible to manually use a filter on a file with gtk_recent_filter_filter().
Recently used files are supported since GTK+ 2.10.

refsect2.title: GtkRecentFilter
refsect2.para: The GtkRecentFilter struct contains only private fields and should not be directly accessed.

refsect2.title: GtkRecentFilterInfo
refsect2.para: A GtkRecentFilterInfo struct is used to pass information about the tested file to gtk_recent_filter_filter().

listitem.simpara: Flags indicating which of the following fields need are filled
the URI of the file being tested
the string that will be used to display the file in the recent chooser
the mime type of the file
the list of applications that have registered the file
the groups to which the file belongs to
the number of days elapsed since the file has been registered

refsect2.title: enum GtkRecentFilterFlags
refsect2.para: These flags indicate what parts of a GtkRecentFilterInfo struct are filled or need to be filled.

listitem.simpara: the URI of the file being tested
the string that will be used to display the file in the recent chooser
the mime type of the file
the list of applications that have registered the file
the groups to which the file belongs to
the number of days elapsed since the file has been registered

refsect2.title: GtkRecentFilterFunc ()
refsect2.para: The type of function that is used with custom filters, see gtk_recent_filter_add_custom().

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilterInfo that is filled according to the needed flags passed to gtk_recent_filter_add_custom()
user data passed to gtk_recent_filter_add_custom()
%TRUE if the file should be displayed

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_new ()
refsect2.para:
Creates a new GtkRecentFilter with no rules added to it. Such filter does not accept any recently used resources, so is not particularly useful until you add rules with gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern(), gtk_recent_filter_add_mime_type(), gtk_recent_filter_add_application(), gtk_recent_filter_add_age(). To create a filter that accepts any recently used resource, use:
GtkRecentFilter *filter = gtk_recent_filter_new (); gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern (filter, "*");

listitem.simpara: a new GtkRecentFilter

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the human-readable name for the filter. See gtk_recent_filter_set_name().

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
the name of the filter, or NULL. The returned string is owned by the filter object and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_set_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the human-readable name of the filter; this is the string that will be displayed in the recently used resources selector user interface if there is a selectable list of filters.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
then human readable name of filter

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

a MIME type

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_add_pattern ()
refsect2.para: Adds a rule that allows resources based on a pattern matching their display name.

a file pattern

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_add_pixbuf_formats ()
refsect2.para: Adds a rule allowing image files in the formats supported by GdkPixbuf.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_add_application ()
refsect2.para: Adds a rule that allows resources based on the name of the application that has registered them.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
an application name

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_add_group ()

a group name

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_add_age ()
refsect2.para: Adds a rule that allows resources based on their age - that is, the number of days elapsed since they were last modified.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
number of days

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_add_custom ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_recent_filter_add_custom (GtkRecentFilter *filter, GtkRecentFilterFlags needed, GtkRecentFilterFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify data_destroy);
refsect2.para: Adds a rule to a filter that allows resources based on a custom callback function. The bitfield needed which is passed in provides information about what sorts of information that the filter function needs; this allows GTK+ to avoid retrieving expensive information when it isn't needed by the filter.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
bitfield of flags indicating the information that the custom filter function needs.
callback function; if the function returns TRUE, then the file will be displayed.
data to pass to func
function to call to free data when it is no longer needed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_get_needed ()
refsect2.para: Gets the fields that need to be filled in for the structure passed to gtk_recent_filter_filter()
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of GtkRecentChooser.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
bitfield of flags indicating needed fields when calling gtk_recent_filter_filter()

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_filter_filter ()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a file should be displayed according to filter. The GtkRecentFilterInfo structure filter_info should include the fields returned from gtk_recent_filter_get_needed().
This function will not typically be used by applications; it is intended principally for use in the implementation of GtkRecentChooser.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentFilter
a GtkRecentFilterInfo structure containing information about a recently used resource
TRUE if the file should be displayed
